titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Central College of Ohio was organized by the Presbytery of Marion, Ohio, in March 1842. Squire Timothy Lee gave 100 acres of land and an endowment, and provided for the initial facilities, which included four buildings. The school continued to operate until 1893, when it was forced to close due to lack of financial support.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Trustees minutes, 1841-1858, of the Central College of Ohio. The minutes for the board's quarterly meetings detail the setting up of the college, including a plan of college buildings, election of officers, and fund raising. The minutes also include reports from committees, correspondence received, and financial reports.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
